description:
First time use: I clicked on "help"-> Contents to browse/search help information. It failed, saying likely "gnucash-docs" was not installed.

That was true. (Why would you not install the docs as a dependency of the main package?) Anyway, so I installed the gnucash-docs package. Now, I tried relaunching gnucash from the Software Centre, and tried help again. I got the same failure and same message.

So much for gnucash. :( :(
I dont think this is the real gnucash. get the gnucash with the icon not the "-jz
Help does not work and the GUI is only menus.
Simple like a checkbook. Must have

This is the GTK 2 version (missing many features) which has not been uodated for a LONG time!

Install the 'normal' version from the ubuntu repository (gnucash, not gnucash-jz) for the most up to date and stable version (with help documantation working)

I was looking for something like this app. It is imple to use and I really appreciate you making it free software.

Thank you!
summary: Simple to use, prefer it to any Excel Tracking

description: Was using Quicken Home and Small Business but find this FREE app to be equal or better for my purposes. Thanks a ton mates !
summary: Does What It Is Supposed To

description:
Ubuntu is not providing the official version of Gnucash in its repositories.
gnucash-jz is a good try but limited compared to the latest official version of GnuCash.
There are various ways to get the official version, however an easier way if your are not very technical is to get it by installing Flatpak repository which gets added to your ubunutu repository. When installing, Flatpak will take care of the dependencies that need to be installed for the app to work.
Read more here: https://flatpak.org/setup/Ubuntu/
summary: It is possible to get the official version from Flatpak

description:
Anything I believe is logic, this software will prove me wrong. For exmple, you made a purchase using your Debit card. You'll enter it as expense in a category and think it will automatically deduct the purchase from your checking balance. Nope, it just sits there and waits for something the user must do. So you tell to deduct from your checking. Eventually it will do so. Now you run a report, because I have no idea if something happened or not. Suddenly, the report shows ??? not what I would expect. The numbers are all over the place and don't make sense, at least not to me. I think I will continue my speadsheet at least there, I know how it reacts.
Fazit: If I have to figure out what the software does when I do something and what the result will be, I might as well use a spreadsheet! One would expect that the software will ease the task on hand. Sorry, it doesn't cut it for me.

Gnucash is always 'almost' perfect, from a functional point of view. It is double entry, which is appropriate and easy enough to navigate. There are a few areas where I wish new energy and community investment could take this program forward in the future. I think its power and potential go under-recognised because Ubuntu does not support the latest stable builds in the repositories. Such a shame. I love this program and I would love to put more money into it if I could be sure it would be spent on projects for specific improvements.
summary: It's a very old version of a great program

description: love it and it is so easy to use

J'utilise Gnucash depuis de très nombreuses années pour ma comptabilité personnelle de quatre comptes. Je fais le rapprochement pour deux et c'est vraiement très utile pour équilibrer mon budget avec deux monaies, j'habithe en zone frontalière. 
Merci les créateurs, j'apprécie beaucoup !

François Martigny
summary: Excellent, complet, intuitif, parfait en résumé
